00035 '''This file generates shell code for the setup.SHELL scripts to set environment variables'''
00036 
00037 from __future__ import print_function
00038 import argparse
00039 import copy
00040 import os
00041 import platform
00042 import sys
00043 
00044 # environment at generation time
00045 CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH = os.pathsep.join('/opt/ros/groovy'.split(';'))
00046 CURRENT_WORKSPACE = os.path.dirname(__file__)
00047 
00048 CATKIN_MARKER_FILE = '.catkin'
00049 
00050 system = platform.system()
00051 IS_DARWIN = (system == 'Darwin')
00052 IS_WINDOWS = (system == 'Windows')
00053 
00054 # subfolder of workspace prepended to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
00055 ENV_VAR_SUBFOLDERS = {
00056     'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH': '',
00057     'CPATH': 'include',
00058     'LD_LIBRARY_PATH' if not IS_DARWIN else 'DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH': 'lib',
00059     'PATH': 'bin',
00060     'PKG_CONFIG_PATH': 'lib/pkgconfig',
00061     'PYTHONPATH': 'lib/python2.7/dist-packages',
00062 }
00063 
00064 
00065 def rollback_env_variables(environ, env_var_subfolders):
00066     '''
00067     Generate shell code to reset environment variables
00068     by unrolling modifications based on all workspaces in CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH.
00069     This does not cover modifications performed by environment hooks.
00070     '''
00071     lines = []
00072     unmodified_environ = copy.copy(environ)
00073     for key in sorted(env_var_subfolders.keys()):
00074         subfolder = env_var_subfolders[key]
00075         value = _rollback_env_variable(unmodified_environ, key, subfolder)
00076         if value is not None:
00077             environ[key] = value
00078             lines.append(assignment(key, value))
00079     if lines:
00080         lines.insert(0, comment('reset environment variables by unrolling modifications based on all workspaces in CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH'))
00081     return lines
00082 
00083 
00084 def _rollback_env_variable(environ, name, subfolder):
00085     '''
00086     For each catkin workspace in CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH remove the first entry from env[NAME] matching workspace + subfolder.
00087 
00088     :param subfolder: str '' or subfoldername that may start with '/'
00089     :returns: the updated value of the environment variable.
00090     '''
00091     value = environ[name] if name in environ else ''
00092     env_paths = [path for path in value.split(os.pathsep) if path]
00093     value_modified = False
00094     if subfolder:
00095         if subfolder.startswith(os.path.sep) or (os.path.altsep and subfolder.startswith(os.path.altsep)):
00096             subfolder = subfolder[1:]
00097         if subfolder.endswith(os.path.sep) or (os.path.altsep and subfolder.endswith(os.path.altsep)):
00098             subfolder = subfolder[:-1]
00099     for ws_path in _get_workspaces(environ, include_fuerte=True):
00100         path_to_find = os.path.join(ws_path, subfolder) if subfolder else ws_path
00101         path_to_remove = None
00102         for env_path in env_paths:
00103             env_path_clean = env_path[:-1] if env_path and env_path[-1] in [os.path.sep, os.path.altsep] else env_path
00104             if env_path_clean == path_to_find:
00105                 path_to_remove = env_path
00106                 break
00107         if path_to_remove:
00108             env_paths.remove(path_to_remove)
00109             value_modified = True
00110     new_value = os.pathsep.join(env_paths)
00111     return new_value if value_modified else None
00112 
00113 
00114 def _get_workspaces(environ, include_fuerte=False):
00115     '''
00116     Based on CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH return all catkin workspaces.
00117 
00118     :param include_fuerte: The flag if paths starting with '/opt/ros/fuerte' should be considered workspaces, ``bool``
00119     '''
00120     # get all cmake prefix paths
00121     env_name = 'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH'
00122     value = environ[env_name] if env_name in environ else ''
00123     paths = [path for path in value.split(os.pathsep) if path]
00124     # remove non-workspace paths
00125     workspaces = [path for path in paths if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(path, CATKIN_MARKER_FILE)) or (include_fuerte and path.startswith('/opt/ros/fuerte'))]
00126     return workspaces
00127 
00128 
00129 def prepend_env_variables(environ, env_var_subfolders, current_workspace, parent_workspaces):
00130     '''
00131     Generate shell code to prepend environment variables
00132     for the current and all parent workspaces.
00133     '''
00134     lines = []
00135     lines.append(comment('prepend folders of workspaces to environment variables'))
00136 
00137     value = '%s%s%s' % (current_workspace, os.pathsep, parent_workspaces)
00138     paths = [path for path in value.split(os.pathsep) if path]
00139 
00140     prefix = _prefix_env_variable(environ, 'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH', paths, '')
00141     lines.append(prepend(environ, 'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH', prefix))
00142 
00143     for key in sorted([key for key in env_var_subfolders.keys() if key != 'CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH']):
00144         subfolder = env_var_subfolders[key]
00145         prefix = _prefix_env_variable(environ, key, paths, subfolder)
00146         lines.append(prepend(environ, key, prefix))
00147     return lines
00148 
00149 
00150 def _prefix_env_variable(environ, name, paths, subfolder):
00151     '''
00152     Return the prefix to prepend to the environment variable NAME, adding any path in NEW_PATHS_STR without creating duplicate or empty items.
00153     '''
00154     value = environ[name] if name in environ else ''
00155     environ_paths = [path for path in value.split(os.pathsep) if path]
00156     checked_paths = []
00157     for path in paths:
00158         if subfolder:
00159             path = os.path.join(path, subfolder)
00160         # exclude any path already in env and any path we already added
00161         if path not in environ_paths and path not in checked_paths:
00162             checked_paths.append(path)
00163     prefix_str = os.pathsep.join(checked_paths)
00164     if prefix_str != '' and environ_paths:
00165         prefix_str += os.pathsep
00166     return prefix_str
00167 
00168 
00169 def assignment(key, value):
00170     if not IS_WINDOWS:
00171         return 'export %s="%s"' % (key, value)
00172     else:
00173         return 'set %s="%s"' % (key, value)
00174 
00175 
00176 def comment(msg):
00177     if not IS_WINDOWS:
00178         return '# %s' % msg
00179     else:
00180         return 'REM %s' % msg
00181 
00182 
00183 def prepend(environ, key, prefix):
00184     if key not in environ or not environ[key]:
00185         return assignment(key, prefix)
00186     if not IS_WINDOWS:
00187         return 'export %s="%s$%s"' % (key, prefix, key)
00188     else:
00189         return 'set %s="%s%%%s%%"' % (key, prefix, key)
00190 
00191 
00192 def _parse_arguments(args=None):
00193     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Generates code blocks for the setup.SHELL script.')
00194     parser.add_argument('--extend', action='store_true', help='Skip unsetting previous environment variables to extend context')
00195     return parser.parse_known_args(args=args)[0]
00196 
00197 
00198 if __name__ == '__main__':
00199     try:
00200         args = _parse_arguments()
00201     except Exception as e:
00202         print(e, file=sys.stderr)
00203         exit(1)
00204 
00205     environ = dict(os.environ)
00206     lines = []
00207     if not args.extend:
00208         lines += rollback_env_variables(environ, ENV_VAR_SUBFOLDERS)
00209     lines += prepend_env_variables(environ, ENV_VAR_SUBFOLDERS, CURRENT_WORKSPACE, CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH)
00210     print('\n'.join(lines))
00211     sys.exit(0)
